title: Theoretical study on the role of magnesium chloride complexes induced by different magnesium-to-chlorine ratios in magnesium–sulfur batteries
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,9668-9677
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA00950A, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Xiaoli Jiang, Panyu Zhang, liyuan Jiang, Xinxin Zhao, Jianbao Wu
In Mg–S batteries, MgCl2 is an ideal anionic salt. Ratios of Mg2+ and Cl− in S-reduction complexes differ, which are 1 : 1 and 1 : 1.3 in DME solvent. In THF solvent, the Mg/Cl ratios are 1 : 2 and 1 : 1.5. DME may perform better with a low Mg/Cl ratio, while THF may excel with a high Mg/Cl ratio.
